summary: Tested warranty workflow features: Admin In Service tab, View Track popup with technician assignment, and Technician portal visibility. All 5 requested features are working correctly.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Warranty workflow is fully functional. Admin can view In Service issues (no duplicates), open View Track popup, assign/re-assign technicians. Calendar entries are created for warranty service issues. Technicians can see warranty service tasks in their Services page.

admin_in_service_tab.notes: In Service tab shows only ONE issue per warranty case (parent issue with status 'in_service'). No duplicates. Tab shows count correctly (e.g., 'In Service (2)').

complete_service_view_track_buttons.notes: Both 'Complete Service' and 'View Track' buttons are visible on In Service issues. Complete Service opens resolve dialog for the linked warranty service issue.

view_track_popup.notes: View Track popup shows: Product Information, Original Issue details (code, title, description, status), Warranty Service Issue (Routed) details with technician assignment section.

technician_assignment_via_track.notes: Admin can assign/re-assign technician from View Track popup. Dropdown shows Technician 1, 2, 3. Assign button is disabled when same technician is already selected.

calendar_entry_creation.notes: When technician is assigned to warranty service issue, a calendar entry with source='warranty_service' is created. Entry appears in technician's calendar.

technician_warranty_tasks_visibility.notes: Technician can see warranty service tasks in their Services page under 'In Progress Issues' section. Issue shows with 'make_service' type badge and '[Warranty Service]' prefix in title.

current_data_state.notes: Issue 2026_VLN-001_01_14_3 is in_service with linked warranty service issue 2026_VLN-001_01_14_4 assigned to Technician 1
